newsitem.title: GREECE: GREEK PUBLIC PETROLEUM (DEP) CUTS GASOLINE PRICES.
newsitem.headline: GREEK PUBLIC PETROLEUM (DEP) CUTS GASOLINE PRICES.

text.p: Greece's Public Petroleum Corporation (DEP) will reduce gasoline prices by 1.90 drachmas per litre, effective on Thursday.
Transport diesel prices will be decreased by 0.90 drachmas per litre, it said.
The price adjustments come after world gasoline, diesel prices fell by $9.10 and $4.4 per metric tonne despite a firmer dollar/drachma exchange rate, up 1.38 drachmas per $, DEP said.
